Generation I.Red: Although long extinct, in rare cases, it can be genetically resurrected from fossils.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Although long extinct, in rare cases, it can be genetically resurrected from fossils.
Generation I.Yellow: An ancient Pok é mon that was recovered from a fossil. It swims by cleverly twisting its 10 tentacles about.
Generation I.Stadium: A prehistoric and long-extinct Pokémon that was resurrected from a fossil. Swims by twisting its 10 tentacles about.

Generation II.Gold: Revived from an ancient fossil, this Pok é mon uses air stored in its shell to sink and rise in water.
Generation II.Silver: This Pok é mon from ancient times is said to have navigated the sea by adeptly twisting its 10 tentacles.
Generation II.Crystal: In prehistoric times, it swam on the sea floor, eating plankton. Its fossils are sometimes found.
Generation II.Stadium 2: Revived from an ancient fossil, this Pok é mon uses air stored in its shell to sink and rise in water. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) This Pok é mon from ancient times is said to have navigated the sea by adeptly twisting its 10 tentacles. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Omanyte is one of the ancient and long-since-extinct Pok é mon that have been regenerated from fossils by people. If attacked by an enemy, it withdraws itself inside its hard shell.
Generation III.Sapphire: Omanyte is one of the ancient and long-since-extinct Pok é mon that have been regenerated from fossils by people. If attacked by an enemy, it withdraws itself inside its hard shell.
Generation III.Emerald: One of the ancient and long-since-extinct Pok é mon that have been regenerated from fossils by humans. If attacked, it withdraws into its hard shell.
Generation III.FireRed: A prehistoric Pok é mon that lived in the primordial sea, it swims by twisting its 10 tentacles about.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Although long extinct, in rare cases, it can be genetically regenerated from fossils.

Generation IV.Diamond: A Pokémon that was resurrected from a fossil using modern science. It swam in ancient seas.
Generation IV.Pearl: A Pokémon that was resurrected from a fossil using modern science. It swam in ancient seas.
Generation IV.Platinum: A Pokémon that was resurrected from a fossil using modern science. It swam in ancient seas.

Generation VI.X: A prehistoric Pokémon that lived in the primordial sea, it swims by twisting its 10 tentacles about.
Generation VI.Y: Revived from an ancient fossil, this Pokémon uses air stored in its shell to sink and rise in water.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Omanyte is one of the ancient and long-since-extinct Pokémon that have been regenerated from fossils by people. If attacked by an enemy, it withdraws itself inside its hard shell.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Omanyte is one of the ancient and long-since-extinct Pokémon that have been regenerated from fossils by people. If attacked by an enemy, it withdraws itself inside its hard shell.

Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Omanyte lived in the seas of antiquity. Its fossils have been found bearing bite marks from Archeops, so apparently Archeops preyed on it.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It was restored from an ancient fossil. Those Helix Fossils are excavated from areas that were once oceans long, long ago.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: An ancient Pokémon that was recovered from a fossil. It swam by cleverly twisting its 10 tentacles about.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: An ancient Pokémon that was recovered from a fossil. It swam by cleverly twisting its 10 tentacles about.

Generation VIII.Sword: Because some Omanyte manage to escape after being restored or are released into the wild by people, this species is becoming a problem.
Generation VIII.Shield: This Pokémon is a member of an ancient, extinct species. Omanyte paddles through water with its 10 tentacles, looking like it's just drifting along.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It's a Pokémon that was resurrected from a fossil using modern science. It swam in ancient seas.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It's a Pokémon that was resurrected from a fossil using modern science. It swam in ancient seas.
